meanings.sent1: My grandfather's old watch is ultrareliable, always keeping perfect time.
meanings.sent2: The new car model is known for being ultrareliable, rarely breaking down.
meanings.sent3: Even the mischievous cat found the ultrareliable mouse trap impossible to outsmart.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like an ultrareliable computer, never forgetting a single detail.
meanings.sent5: The ultrareliable lighthouse guided ships safely through the stormy night.

meanings.sent1: The ultrareliable student always scored the highest marks in class.
meanings.sent2: The ultrareliable machine never failed to complete its tasks efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The ultrareliable chef's dishes were so good, they seemed to dance on the taste buds.
meanings.sent4: His ultrareliable voice carried through the auditorium, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The ultrareliable sun rose every morning, painting the sky with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: Having a high level of reliability.
meanings.sent1: The ultrareliable internet connection allowed me to work without any interruptions.
meanings.sent2: The ultrareliable weather forecast helped us plan our outdoor activities with confidence.
meanings.sent3: The ultrareliable umbrella turned inside out in the strong wind, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: His ultrareliable smile brightened even the gloomiest of days.
meanings.sent5: The ultrareliable security system kept the house safe from any intruders.
